definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet
woven mat/seat/banquet/place in a democratic assembly/classifier for banquets, conversations etc
can/to be possible/to be able to/will/to be likely to/to be sure to/to assemble/to meet/to gather/to see/union/group/association/CL:個|个[ge4]/a moment (Taiwan pr. for this sense is [hui3])

sentences.english: It ' s the joint chief - of - staff , sir.
sentences.chinese: 是，参谋长联席会议主席，先生。

sentences.english: to be responsible for the daily work of the retired officials' joint meetings.
sentences.chinese: 负责离退休干部工作联席会议的日常工作。

sentences.english: Participants of a joint military-civilian meeting shall be decided on by conveners of the meeting.
sentences.chinese: 军地联席会议的参加人员由会议召集人确定。

sentences.english: The constitution was to go into effect when that joint session was convened.
sentences.chinese: 宪法将于该次联席会议开会后生效。

sentences.english: To undertake day-to-day work of the Joint Inter-ministerial Meeting of the State Council for Marine Salvages ;
sentences.chinese: 承担国务院海上搜救部际联席会议的日常工作。

sentences.english: President Lee held a meeting with the Joint Chiefs of Staff in Seoul.
sentences.chinese: 韩总统李在首尔举行了参谋长联席会议。

definition: to convene (a conference or meeting)/to convoke/to call together

leading small group (LSG), a CCP body that exercises general oversight on matters relating to a specific area (LSG for foreign affairs 外事工作, LSG for comprehensively deepening reforms 全面深化改革 etc)/aka central leading group
to call a conference/to convene a meeting
consultative conference (political venue during early communist rule)/consultative meeting/deliberative assembly
general congress/meeting of the whole committee
to lead (an animal by the head)/to take the lead/to coordinate (a combined operation)/to mediate/a go-between (e.g. marriage broker)
